sandwiches.Description: Traditionally uses sliced turkey breast, ham, roast beef, American, Swiss or Provolone cheese, chopped or shredded lettuce, tomatoes and green peppers on a roll of bread.
sandwiches.Name: American sub

sandwiches.Description: Often eaten with ketchup or brown sauce.
sandwiches.Name: Bacon

sandwiches.Description: Breakfast sandwich, usually with fried or scrambled egg.
sandwiches.Name: Bacon, egg and cheese

sandwiches.Description: Pressed, toasted bagel filled with vegetables and cheese and grilled on a sandwich toaster or panini press.
sandwiches.Name: Bagel toast

sandwiches.Description: Canned baked beans on white or brown bread, sometimes with butter.
sandwiches.Name: Baked bean

sandwiches.Description: Filling is typically meat, but can contain a wide range of foods, including sardines, tofu, pâté, or eggs. Served on an airy baguette with pickled carrots, cilantro and peppers.
sandwiches.Name: Bánh mì

sandwiches.Description: Served on a bun, with chopped, sliced, or shredded meat (pulled pork, beef, or chicken typically), and sometimes topped with coleslaw.
sandwiches.Name: Barbecue
sandwiches.Origin: United States (Texas, Tennessee, North Carolina, Alabama, Kansas, Missouri, Mississippi, Arizona, Utah, Nevada, Colorado & Louisiana)

sandwiches.Description: Ham and cheese, usually mantecoso, which is similar to farmer cheese.
sandwiches.Name: Barros Jarpa

sandwiches.Description: Beef (usually thin-cut steak) and cheese.
sandwiches.Name: Barros Luco

sandwiches.Description: Melted cheese, roast beef, tomato, and pickled cucumber in a hollowed-out French roll.
sandwiches.Name: Bauru

sandwiches.Description: Roast beef on a Kummelweck roll, often topped with horseradish.
sandwiches.Name: Beef on weck

sandwiches.Description: Melted cheese, sliced fresh tomatoes with oregano, lettuce leaves, roast beef on pita bread with mayonnaise.
sandwiches.Name: Beirute

sandwiches.Description: Named for its ingredients: bacon, lettuce, and tomato. Often served on toasted sliced bread spread with mayonnaise.
sandwiches.Name: BLT

sandwiches.Description: Baguette bread with some variants of filling, often eaten in cafes and tapas bars.
sandwiches.Name: Bocadillo

sandwiches.Description: Sliced and sometimes fried bologna sausage between slices of white bread, with various condiments such as mustard, mayonnaise, ketchup.
sandwiches.Name: Bologna

sandwiches.Description: Usually grilled on white bread, containing a bratwurst sausage, onions, and a blend of tomato ketchup, mustard, and curry powder.
sandwiches.Name: Bosna

sandwiches.Description: A popular street food in Germany, often served on a roll with mustard in which case it is a sandwich. Some vendors offer a side dish of sauerkraut or french fries.
sandwiches.Name: Bratwurst

sandwiches.Description: Convenience dish on a variety of bread rolls, containing such breakfast items as sausages, bacon, white or black pudding, mushrooms, tomatoes, hash browns, and fried eggs, often eaten with ketchup or brown sauce.
sandwiches.Name: Breakfast roll

sandwiches.Description: Typically a scrambled or fried egg, cheese, and a sausage patty or other breakfast meat, served on a biscuit or English muffin.
sandwiches.Name: Breakfast

sandwiches.Description: Reference to the poor quality of catering on the now-defunct British Rail, this refers to any poor-quality sandwich, often stale.
sandwiches.Name: British Rail

sandwiches.Description: Soft bread roll containing a ragout-based croquette, often eaten with mustard.
sandwiches.Name: Broodje kroket

sandwiches.Description: Consists of a shallow-fried, spicy patty, onions, and chutney or raita in a hamburger or hot dog bun.
sandwiches.Name: Bun kebab

sandwiches.Description: Single, open-faced, with butter.
sandwiches.Name: Butterbrot

sandwiches.Description: Breaded and fried mozzarella sandwich.
sandwiches.Name: Carrozza

sandwiches.Description: Sliced avocado, meat, white cheese, onions, and red sauce (salsa roja), on a fluffy sesame-seeded egg roll, originally from the city of Puebla.
sandwiches.Name: Cemita

sandwiches.Description: Thinly sliced churrasco-style steak, or lomito-style pork, with tomatoes, green beans, and green chiles, served on a round roll.
sandwiches.Name: Chacarero

sandwiches.Description: Made with one or more varieties of cheese, often with other ingredients, such as butter or mayonnaise. When toasted (pictured), it is commonly referred to as a grilled cheese sandwich.
sandwiches.Name: Cheese
sandwiches.Origin: Global (Such As Asia, Africa, Oceania, Europe, The Americas)

sandwiches.Description: Open-faced grilled cheese sandwich with bacon.
sandwiches.Name: Cheese dream

sandwiches.Description: Slices of cheese (typically Cheddar) and pickle (a sweet, vinegary chutney with the most popular brand being Branston), sandwiched between two slices of bread.
sandwiches.Name: Cheese and pickle

sandwiches.Description: Thinly sliced steak and melted cheese in a hoagie roll, with additional toppings often including peppers, onions, and mushrooms, also known as a Philadelphia or Philly cheesesteak.
sandwiches.Name: Cheesesteak

sandwiches.Description: Chicken sandwich can contain chicken cooked in a variety of ways. In the United States, common forms of chicken sandwiches include the grilled chicken breast sandwich, the fried chicken breast sandwich, the chicken salad sandwich, and the shredded (or barbeque) chicken sandwich.
sandwiches.Name: Chicken

sandwiches.Description: A bread roll filled with a fillet of processed chicken. It is a ubiquitous deli item in Ireland, served hot.
sandwiches.Name: Chicken fillet roll

sandwiches.Description: Sandwich prepared with chicken salad as a filling.
sandwiches.Name: Chicken salad

sandwiches.Description: Sandwich of crumbed, pan-fried chicken fillet, on buttered bread, with shredded iceberg lettuce and mayonnaise. An adaptation of the Austrian or Viennese schnitzel sandwich, which consists of crumbed pork, veal or chicken schnitzel on a Semmel or kaiser roll with mayonnaise or mustard and shredded lettuce. See also Cutlet sandwich, Italian.
sandwiches.Name: Chicken schnitzel

sandwiches.Description: Hamburger, with the patty topped with chili con carne.
sandwiches.Name: Chili burger

sandwiches.Description: Ground beef, chicken, or pork leg served on pan de agua and garnished with cabbage and salsa rosa.
sandwiches.Name: Chimichurris

sandwiches.Description: Sliced white bread (or a large, flat bread roll) filled with chips, usually sprinkled with salt and vinegar or tomato ketchup.
sandwiches.Name: Chip butty

sandwiches.Description: Sandwich prepared with thinly sliced or pressed salted and dried beef. Some chipped beef is smoked to add flavor.
sandwiches.Name: Chipped beef
sandwiches.Origin: United States (Mid-Atlantic region and military cuisine)

sandwiches.Description: Filet mignon with mozzarella, tomatoes, mayonnaise, and commonly bacon, black or green olives, fried or hardboiled eggs, and ham
sandwiches.Name: Chivito

sandwiches.Description: Rye bread, butter and chocolate shot or sprinkles (fine small chocolate candies).
sandwiches.Name: Chocolate

sandwiches.Description: Made on a grill with ground beef, onions, and topped by melted cheese and served with lettuce, tomatoes, and condiments on a hero roll.
sandwiches.Name: Chopped cheese

sandwiches.Description: Grilled chorizo, usually served on a crusty roll with salsa-type condiments, such as pebre, salsa criolla, or chimichurri. Morcipán is a variety of this using black pudding or blood sausage.
sandwiches.Name: Choripán

sandwiches.Description: Gravy-based chow mein mixture placed on a hamburger bun, served hot
sandwiches.Name: Chow mein sandwich

sandwiches.Description: Thinly cut steak, grilled and served on a toasted bun. It can be served with almost any other ingredient, in which case its name changes to "churrasco+the new ingredient" (e.g.: churrasco palta = churrasco and avocado).
sandwiches.Name: Churrasco

sandwiches.Description: Triple-decker sandwich made with sliced turkey or chicken, bacon, tomato, and lettuce; usually contains mayonnaise.
sandwiches.Name: Club

sandwiches.Description: Corned beef often served with a condiment such as pickle or mustard.
sandwiches.Name: Corned beef

sandwiches.Description: Crisps and occasionally pickles on white bread.
sandwiches.Name: Crisp

sandwiches.Description: Baked or fried ham and cheese (typically Emmental or Gruyère) brioche-sandwich, sometimes coated in a mornay or béchamel sauce.
sandwiches.Name: Croque-monsieur

sandwiches.Description: Same as a croque-monsieur, but with a fried egg on top.
sandwiches.Name: Croque-madame

sandwiches.Description: Ham, roasted pork, Swiss cheese, pickles, mustard, and sometimes Genoa salami on Cuban bread, sometimes pressed and warmed in a plancha.
sandwiches.Name: Cuban
sandwiches.Origin: United States (Tampa or Key West, Florida) / Cuba

sandwiches.Description: Two thin slices of crustless, lightly buttered white bread, containing paper-thin slices of peeled cucumber. Often as a tea sandwich.
sandwiches.Name: Cucumber

sandwiches.Description: Spicy cudighi (a Michigan variety of Cotechino Italian sausage), on a long, hard roll, often topped with mozzarella and tomato sauce
sandwiches.Name: Cudighi

sandwiches.Description: Multiple layers containing a wide variety of meats and condiments, named for Dagwood Bumstead of the comic strip Blondie.
sandwiches.Name: Dagwood

sandwiches.Description: Sandwich usually ordered at a deli; choices include type of bread (toasted or untoasted,) type of meat (cold cut), type of sliced cheese, vegetable fillings (lettuce, tomato, onion, etc.), and condiments.
sandwiches.Name: Deli

sandwiches.Description: Sandwich containing a Denver omelette.
sandwiches.Name: Denver

sandwiches.Description: Döner kebab is meat cooked on a vertical spit, normally veal or beef but also may be a mixture of these with lamb, and sometimes chicken. This may be served wrapped in a flatbread such as lavash or pita, or as a sandwich.
sandwiches.Name: Döner kebab

sandwiches.Description: Chopped or shredded savory donkey meat in a bun, sold in Baoding, Hebei Province as street food, and also in high-end restaurants.
sandwiches.Name: Donkey burger

sandwiches.Description: Two flat fried bara (bread), containing curried chickpeas or garbanzo beans.
sandwiches.Name: Doubles

sandwiches.Description: A sandwich made with a doughnut instead of bread (can be made with fried chicken, bacon, ham, sausage, cheese, etc.)
sandwiches.Name: Doughnut sandwich

sandwiches.Description: Made with a piece of dark rye bread, a layer of leverpostej, topped with a slice of salt beef and a slice of meat aspic, topped with raw onion rings and garden cress.
sandwiches.Name: Dyrlægens natmad

sandwiches.Description: Peanut butter, banana, and bacon.
sandwiches.Name: Elvis

sandwiches.Description: Generic sandwich: This contains eggs, usually sliced hard boiled eggs or egg salad, but may be made with fried or (more rarely) scrambled egg, topped with the local roe spread, locally called kaviar.Egg salad sandwich: A chopped egg mixed with mayonnaise.Eggs Benedict is an open-faced sandwich consisting of an English muffin topped with meat, eggs, and hollandaise sauce.Egg spread: Polish version of egg salad, similar to a Japanese egg salad sandwich, most of the times with addition of garlic and Polish pickled cucumbers mixed in.
sandwiches.Name: Egg

sandwiches.Description: Deep-fried balls of ground, seasoned chickpeas topped with salad vegetables, hot sauce, tahini-based sauces, and pickled vegetables, wrapped in or added to the pocket of a split-open pita bread.
sandwiches.Name: Falafel

sandwiches.Description: Crusty bread rolls filled with fish (most commonly Bismarck or soused herring) and onions.
sandwiches.Name: Fischbrötchen

sandwiches.Description: A common British comfort food.
sandwiches.Name: Fish finger

sandwiches.Description: Peanut butter and marshmallow creme.
sandwiches.Name: Fluffernutter

sandwiches.Description: Consists of a single warmed, hollowed-out loaf of bread filled with one jar of creamy peanut butter, one jar of grape jelly, and a pound of bacon. In 1976, Elvis Presley and some of his friends flew to Colorado to consume them.
sandwiches.Name: Fool's Gold Loaf

sandwiches.Description: Wet-cured ham, linguiça, fresh sausage, steak or other roast meat, topped with melted cheese, a hot thick tomato and beer sauce.
sandwiches.Name: Francesinha

sandwiches.Description: Bun with wet-cured ham, linguiça, and cheese, sauced with butter or margarine, piri-piri, and port wine, whiskey, cognac, or brandy.
sandwiches.Name: Francesinha poveira

sandwiches.Description: Thinly sliced roast beef on a baguette, served hot, usually au jus (with juice).
sandwiches.Name: French dip

sandwiches.Description: Sliced pork or calves' brain, battered and deep-fried, on rye bread or hamburger bun, often served with pickles, raw onion, and mustard.
sandwiches.Name: Fried brain

sandwiches.Description: Deli-style sandwich similar to the hoagie, often containing french fries, with other variations, prepared with masala steak, chicken, polony, Vienna sausages, calamari, fish, or chargrilled steak.
sandwiches.Name: Gatsby

sandwiches.Description: Half section of Italian or French bread with garlic butter, containing ham and Provel cheese, topped with paprika, then toasted.
sandwiches.Name: Gerber

sandwiches.Description: A scotch pie on a morning roll
sandwiches.Name: Glasgow Oyster

sandwiches.Description: A slice of bread grilled with melty cheese.
sandwiches.Name: Grilled Cheese

sandwiches.Description: Fujianese sandwich consisting of a slice of stewed meat and other condiments sandwiched between flat steamed bread.
sandwiches.Name: Gua bao

sandwiches.Description: Tamale in a Mexican bolillo roll. A very common morning street food in Mexico City. It is also called torta de tamal.
sandwiches.Name: Guajolota

sandwiches.Description: "Pita gyro" or "psomaki gyro", depending on the type of bread used, includes meat roasted on a vertical spit, with tomato, potatoes, raw, often red onion and tzatziki sauce, wrapped in pita or sandwich bread.
sandwiches.Name: Gyro

sandwiches.Description: Chocolate sprinkles or flakes usually served on buttered bread.
sandwiches.Name: Hagelslag or vlokken

sandwiches.Description: May be accompanied by cheese or salad. Condiments such as mustard, mayonnaise, or pickle may be present.
sandwiches.Name: Ham
sandwiches.Origin: Global (Such As France, United States, United Kingdom)

sandwiches.Description: Common sandwich prepared with ham and sliced cheese. Additional ingredients may include lettuce, tomato, mayonnaise, and other ingredients.
sandwiches.Name: Ham and cheese

sandwiches.Description: Sliced Danish canned ham with sliced scrambled egg sheet in a halved sweet bun.
sandwiches.Name: Ham and egg bun

sandwiches.Description: Ground beef patty, often with vegetables, sauces and other meats, usually on a round bun. A cheeseburger is also topped with cheese.
sandwiches.Name: Hamburger

sandwiches.Description: Hot dog wrapped in a beef patty, deep-fried, then covered with chili, a few french fries, and a fried egg.
sandwiches.Name: Hamdog

sandwiches.Description: Har cheong gai (chicken fried with fermented shrimp paste).
sandwiches.Name: Har cheong gai burger

sandwiches.Description: Thick-sliced, toasted, open-faced sandwich, it usually contains hamburger patties or ham, but other meat, such as deep-fried pork tenderloin, grilled or fried chicken breast, and fried fish fillets, can be used. The meat is topped with French fries and covered with a cheese sauce.
sandwiches.Name: Horseshoe

sandwiches.Description: Open-faced with turkey and bacon, topped with mornay sauce, and baked or broiled. Variation of Welsh rarebit.
sandwiches.Name: Hot brown

sandwiches.Description: A hot dog is a food consisting of a grilled or steamed sausage served in the slit of a partially sliced bun. It can also refer to the sausage itself. The sausage used is a wiener or a frankfurter.
sandwiches.Name: Hot dog

sandwiches.Description: Seasoned beef or beans topped with lettuce, diced tomatoes, cheese, and other condiments on Indigenous frybread, often folded.
sandwiches.Name: Indian taco

sandwiches.Description: Thin slices of seasoned, juicy roast beef, often garnished with giardiniera or Italian sweet peppers, on a dense, long Italian-style roll.
sandwiches.Name: Italian beef

sandwiches.Description: Prepared on a long bread roll or bun with meats such as salami, mortadella and capicolla along with cheese, tomato, olive oil, salt and black pepper.
sandwiches.Name: Italian

sandwiches.Description: Buttered bread, with fruit jam/conserve, normally eaten at lunchtime or as a quick snack, may also be eaten at breakfast or for tea.
sandwiches.Name: Jam

sandwiches.Description: French baguette with butter and ham. Also known as "Parisien," it is the most popular sandwich in France.
sandwiches.Name: Jambon-beurre

sandwiches.Description: Meat, cheese, lettuce, and tomato, between flattened, fried green plantains (instead of bread), with garlic-flavored mayonnaise.
sandwiches.Name: Jibarito

sandwiches.Description: Cheeseburger with the cheese inside the meat patty rather than on top.
sandwiches.Name: Jucy Lucy

sandwiches.Description: Breaded, deep-fried pork cutlet (tonkatsu).
sandwiches.Name: Katsu sando(ja)

sandwiches.Description: A flat bread wrap with chips and sausage seasoned with salt, chili powder and curry sauce or ketchup.
sandwiches.Name: Kabuli burger

sandwiches.Description: Finger sandwich with ham, pickles, eggs and cheese.
sandwiches.Name: Kaisers Jagdproviant

sandwiches.Description: Similar to Vietnam's bánh mì, it is a street food prepared using pork liver pâté,
sandwiches.Name: Khao Jee Pâté

sandwiches.Description: Lamb or goat intestines, containing seasoned offal.
sandwiches.Name: Kokoretsi
sandwiches.Origin: Anatolia and Balkans and especially Greece

sandwiches.Description: Buttered brown bread with smoked pork sausage (Kottenwurst), fresh onion rings, and spicy mustard.
sandwiches.Name: Kottenbutter

sandwiches.Description: Turkish sandwich featuring pre-griddled cheese on a special bun enriched with chickpea flour. Kumru translates to "turtledove" in Turkish.
sandwiches.Name: Kumru

sandwiches.Description: Meatloaf-like dish which, despite the name, may contain neither liver nor cheese.  It is commonly served on a Kaiser roll with mustard or mayonnaise.
sandwiches.Name: Leberkäse

sandwiches.Description: They are typically prepared with buttered rye bread, Limburger cheese, sliced onion and mustard. Pictured is Limburger cheese and bread.
sandwiches.Name: Limburger

sandwiches.Description: Lobster meat tossed with either mayonnaise ("cold") or drawn butter ("hot") stuffed into a slit opening at the top of a grilled bread roll or hot dog bun.
sandwiches.Name: Lobster roll
sandwiches.Origin: United States (United States Northeast), Canada (Canada Maritime provinces), United Kingdom (England)

sandwiches.Description: Lox on a bagel with cream cheese, thinly sliced onion, capers, and sometimes sliced tomato.
sandwiches.Name: Lox

sandwiches.Description: Hamburger or cheeseburger on glazed doughnuts instead of a bun.
sandwiches.Name: Luther burger

sandwiches.Description: White bread, butter and orange marmalade, popularized by the Paddington books by Michael Bond.
sandwiches.Name: Marmalade

sandwiches.Description: Marmite spread thinly with butter or margarine onto toast or bread.  Sometimes combined with cheddar cheese.
sandwiches.Name: Marmite

sandwiches.Description: Meatballs in marinara sauce, with melted Parmesan or provolone cheese, on a long bun or section of Italian loaf. Might include Italian-style accompaniments such as bell peppers, basil, or Italian-dressed lettuce.
sandwiches.Name: Meatball

sandwiches.Description: Roast pork, ham, mustard, Swiss cheese, and dill pickles served on sweet bread.
sandwiches.Name: Medianoche

sandwiches.Description: Generic sandwich containing a filling and a layer of cheese, grilled or fried until the cheese is melted.
sandwiches.Name: Melt

sandwiches.Description: Open sandwich consisting of a sliced bun, topped with Mett (seasoned minced raw pork without bacon), frequently with a garnish of raw onion rings or diced raw onion.
sandwiches.Name: Mettbrötchen

sandwiches.Description: French fries and fried meat with sauce on a demi-baguette.
sandwiches.Name: Mitraillette

sandwiches.Description: Open sandwich consisting of a bolillo roll topped with refried beans, cheese and peppers, and grilled.
sandwiches.Name: Mollete

sandwiches.Description: Small, usually grilled, and may contain a variety of fillings. Some bars offer a variety of 200 different types of these sandwiches.
sandwiches.Name: Montadito

sandwiches.Description: Sliced ham and cheese (usually Emmental or Gruyère) between slices of French toast and batter-fried. In some regions it is sprinkled with powdered sugar and served with jelly or jam. In other regions (New England), it is served savory with French mustard and no powdered sugar.
sandwiches.Name: Monte Cristo

sandwiches.Description: Sandwich made from cured and smoked brisket with yellow mustard, usually on rye bread.
sandwiches.Name: Montreal-style smoked meat

sandwiches.Description: Any sandwich containing mortadella, a large Italian sausage.
sandwiches.Name: Mortadella

sandwiches.Description: Hot dog bun containing a Chicago-style corn-roll tamale, topped with chili.
sandwiches.Name: Mother-in-law

sandwiches.Description: Originated in New Orleans' Italian-American community, this contains meats, cheeses, and olive salad on a round bun.
sandwiches.Name: Muffuletta

sandwiches.Description: Vegetables or beef on naan bread.
sandwiches.Name: Naan

sandwiches.Description: Type of open sandwich served as an appetizer or snack.
sandwiches.Name: Obložené chlebíčky

sandwiches.Description: Consists of a single slice of bread with one or more food items on top.
sandwiches.Name: Open-faced
sandwiches.Origin: Nordic (Such As Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, Iceland & Estonia), United States

sandwiches.Description: Made with pambazo bread dipped in a red guajillo pepper sauce and filled with potatoes and chorizo.
sandwiches.Name: Pambazo

sandwiches.Description: Round bread (bread bagnats) topped with green salad, tomatoes, hard-boiled eggs, tuna, anchovies, cucumbers, fava beans, artichokes, green peppers, radishes, onions, basil, and black olives. Condiments may include garlic, vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Served chilled.
sandwiches.Name: Pan-bagnat

sandwiches.Description: In Italy, panino is the word for a sandwich made from bread other than sliced bread, in which case Italians call it a tramezzino. Examples of bread types used are ciabatta, rosetta and baguette. The bread is cut horizontally and filled with deli ingredients such as salami, ham, cheese, mortadella, or other food, and is sometimes pressed by a warming grill. In the United States, United Kingdom, and Canada, the term panini is used to refer to a long pressed and toasted sandwich; there is widespread availability and use of sandwich presses, often known as "panini presses."
sandwiches.Name: Panini

sandwiches.Description: A sandwich made famous in the Jewish kosher delicatessens of New York City.
sandwiches.Name: Pastrami on rye
sandwiches.Origin: United States (New York City, NY), Norway, Sweden, Finland, Denmark, Iceland, Estonia

sandwiches.Description: A meat and potato pasty in a buttered barm cake, particularly popular in Bolton.
sandwiches.Name: Pasty barm

sandwiches.Description: Consists of a hamburger patty, pieces of sautéed or grilled onion, and Cheddar or Swiss cheese between two slices of bread.
sandwiches.Name: Patty melt

sandwiches.Description: A sandwich consists of french fries and condiments such as Ketchup and/or mayonnaise.
sandwiches.Name: Patso

sandwiches.Description: Peameal bacon, a type of back bacon, inside a kaiser roll.
sandwiches.Name: Peameal bacon sandwich

sandwiches.Description: Jam is often used in place of jelly. Also known as a PB&J. PB&J may also be served with fresh fruit rather than jam, with thin sliced apples, pears, or bananas.
sandwiches.Name: Peanut butter and jelly

sandwiches.Description: Simple Argentine sandwich, traditionally filled with cheese, cured meat, tomato, and mayonnaise. Pebete actually refers to the bread used for the sandwich - a soft oval bun with a spongy inside, and a thin toasted crust.
sandwiches.Name: Pebete

sandwiches.Description: Steak sandwich that is common in Mexico and Venezuela. In Spain it usually also contains aioli.
sandwiches.Name: Pepito

sandwiches.Description: Sauteed Italian long hots, sliced (not diced) in olive oil, (garlic is optional), coated with scrambled eggs and cooked until the eggs are firm. Seasoned with salt and pepper and Parmesan or other hard (aged) cheese, such as Romano or Pecorino. Then the mixture is stuffed into an Italian-style roll or between two slices of Italian bread. This may also be served with sliced tomatoes.
sandwiches.Name: Pepper and egg, Italian
sandwiches.Origin: Italy and the United States (in areas where there was a concentration of Italian immigrants).

sandwiches.Description: Roast turkey, cranberries or cranberry sauce and cheddar cheese.
sandwiches.Name: Pilgrim

sandwiches.Description: Common food preparation in the Southern United States, a spread or relish made with cheese, mayonnaise, pimentos, salt and pepper, blended to either a smooth or chunky paste.
sandwiches.Name: Pimento cheese

sandwiches.Description: Stuffed and fried bread roll (sometimes called stuffed pistolettes) in the Cajun areas around Lafayette. This also refers to a type of submarine-shaped bread about half the size of a baguette that is popular in New Orleans for Vietnamese bánh mì and other sandwiches.
sandwiches.Name: Pistolette

sandwiches.Description: Typically served on a kaiser roll.  Popular toppings include onions and tiger sauce (mayonnaise + horseradish).
sandwiches.Name: Pit beef

sandwiches.Description: Patty dish popular in the Balkan region of Southeastern Europe, a sandwich utilizes the Pljeskavica patty and bread.
sandwiches.Name: Pljeskavica

sandwiches.Description: Crusty long roll split and filled with cold cuts, roasted beef or fried seafood. The New Orleans analogue to the sub or hoagie.
sandwiches.Name: Po' boy

sandwiches.Description: Kielbasa sausage in a bun, covered with french fries, barbecue sauce (or hot sauce), and coleslaw.
sandwiches.Name: Polish boy

sandwiches.Description: A sandwich made of roast pork with Italian-type spices such as rosemary, garlic, fennel and others in varying proportions. It is popular as street food (usually sold from white trucks) throughout central Italy.  It was transplanted to America in the late 19th century by Italian immigrants and is known as the "roast" pork sandwich, very popular in the northeastern United States. In America it is often served with provolone cheese and "greens" which may be spinach or broccoli raab.
sandwiches.Name: Porchetta

sandwiches.Description: Half-inch slice of thick sausage, usually with diced red or sweet onion, sliced pickles, ketchup, mustard, and sometimes mayonnaise, on white bread.
sandwiches.Name: Porilainen

sandwiches.Description: Popular dish in Macau, the bun is extremely crisp outside and very soft inside, containing a freshly fried pork chop.
sandwiches.Name: Pork chop bun

sandwiches.Description: Pork roll still is the predominant term in South Jersey, but in the northern part of the state it is "Taylor Ham".
sandwiches.Name: Pork roll sandwich

sandwiches.Description: Thin, tenderized, deep-fried pork loin, typically served on an undersized bun.
sandwiches.Name: Pork tenderloin

sandwiches.Description: Cooked shrimp in a small sandwich roll, dressed with remoulade, Thousand Island dressing or cocktail sauce, sometimes garnished with boiled egg slices and lettuce.
sandwiches.Name: Prawn roll

sandwiches.Description: Selection of grilled meats topped with french fries, coleslaw, and tomato on Italian bread.
sandwiches.Name: Primanti

sandwiches.Description: Open-faced toasted sandwich, usually topped with minced meat (mixed with egg and spices) and kashkaval, though the term could also refer to a vegetarian version topped with a mixture of kashkaval, sirene and egg. Could be seasoned with ketchup, mayonnaise and/or chubritsa or sharena sol (Bulgarian spice mix). A regional term for a princess sandwich with minced meat is strandzhanka.
sandwiches.Name: Princess

sandwiches.Description: Ham and turkey topped with broiled cheese. Sometimes includes bacon and tomato.
sandwiches.Name: Prosperity Sandwich

sandwiches.Description: Barbecue sandwich in which pork (usually shoulder) is smoked slowly at a low temperature until the meat becomes tender enough that it can be "pulled" or shredded with two forks. The pork is served on a bun and often topped with barbecue sauce and vinegar- or mayonnaise-based coleslaw depending on the region.
sandwiches.Name: Pulled pork

sandwiches.Description: Corned beef, sauerkraut, Swiss cheese, topped with Russian or Thousand Island dressing, on rye bread, then grilled.  Creamy coleslaw replaces the sauerkraut in some places.
sandwiches.Name: Reuben
sandwiches.Origin: United States (Omaha, Nebraska or New York, NY)

sandwiches.Description: Sliced roast beef or sometimes beef loaf on bread. A variant of this sandwich is the roast beef special (deli sandwich) which is sliced roast beef, thousand island salad dressing and cole slaw served, generally, on rye bread.
sandwiches.Name: Roast beef
sandwiches.Origin: Global  United States (Pennsylvania, Massachusetts & New Jersey)

sandwiches.Description: Toasted white bread with a filling such as butter, jam, chocolate spread, cheese, or other (generally sweet) fillings.
sandwiches.Name: Roti bakar

sandwiches.Description: Basic ingredients are eggs, chopped onions, sambal paste, salt, and pepper, cooked as an omelette with the bread added on top before it's fully cooked. Many variations include canned sardines, chicken, beef, or mutton. Garnished with mayo, chili sauce, and cheese.
sandwiches.Name: Roti john

sandwiches.Description: Stewed pork, chopped finely, and stuffed in mo, a kind of flatbread.
sandwiches.Name: Rou jia mo

sandwiches.Description: Sandwich made of traditional Finnish dark rye, buttered, with lettuce, hard-boiled egg, pickles, tomato, and choice of cheese and meat (typically pork). Known colloquially as "The Winning Combination."
sandwiches.Name: Ruisleipä

sandwiches.Description: Bun filled with a mixture of (usually) loose meat, cabbage, and cheese. The fillings are baked inside the bread, similar to a kolache. Popular in the Midwestern United States, especially Nebraska.
sandwiches.Name: Runza

sandwiches.Description: Pita stuffed with fried aubergine, sliced hard boiled egg, tahini sauce and Israeli salad, among other ingredients.
sandwiches.Name: Sabich

sandwiches.Description: Hot pastrami, grilled knockwurst, melted Swiss and hot mustard on rye bread.
sandwiches.Name: Sailor

sandwiches.Description: Type of sandwich eaten in Argentina and Uruguay. Mainly a large schnitzel with lettuce and sliced tomato, sometimes with added sliced boiled egg, and mayonnaise. Usually but not exclusively the bread is a white baton or a short baguette type of bread. Pictured is a sándwich de milanesa from Tucumán.
sandwiches.Name: Sándwich de milanesa

sandwiches.Description: Alternating layers of bread and filling frosted to resemble a layer cake.
sandwiches.Name: Sandwich loaf

sandwiches.Description: Made with single-, double-, or triple-layered, buttered, very thin white bread with crust removed, toasted or un-toasted, containing thinly sliced meat, as well as eggs, cheese, tomatoes, green peppers, lettuce, olives, and sometimes other vegetables. Similar to the British finger sandwiches for afternoon tea, but the bread layers are thinner.
sandwiches.Name: Sandwiches de miga

sandwiches.Description: Corned beef served in a bagel, sometimes with English mustard and pickles.
sandwiches.Name: Salt beef bagel

sandwiches.Description: The filling in this sandwich is sealed between two layers of bread by a crimped edge and has the crust subsequently removed. A popular variety in the United States is peanut butter and jelly. This type of sandwich is mass-produced by The J. M. Smucker Company under the brand name "Uncrustables".
sandwiches.Name: Sealed crustless

sandwiches.Description: Flatbread with meat (traditionally lamb) cooked on a vertical spit. Additional fillings include vegetables such as tomato, cucumbers, onions, and pickles, and a sauce, often yogurt- or tahini-based.
sandwiches.Name: Shawarma
sandwiches.Origin: The Levant  Arab world  Middle East

sandwiches.Description: Prepared by filling a hollowed-out long loaf of bread with cooked filet mignon steak, cooked mushrooms, salt and pepper.
sandwiches.Name: Shooter's sandwich

sandwiches.Description: A miniature hamburger about three inches in diameter, but may also contain other toppings
sandwiches.Name: Slider

sandwiches.Description: Ground meat, usually beef, cooked with seasoned tomato sauce and served on a round bun.
sandwiches.Name: Sloppy joe

sandwiches.Description: Triple-decker rye bread sandwich made with one or more types of sliced deli meat, such as turkey, ham, pastrami, corned beef, roast beef, or sliced beef tongue, along with Swiss cheese, coleslaw, and Russian dressing.
sandwiches.Name: Sloppy joe (New Jersey)

sandwiches.Description: Multiple layers of white or light rye bread containing creamy fillings, such as egg and mayonnaise, liver paté, olives, shrimp, ham, various cold cuts, caviar, tomato, cucumber, cheese, and smoked salmon.
sandwiches.Name: Smörgåstårta

sandwiches.Description: Open-faced, buttered dark rye bread with cold cuts, pieces of meat or fish, cheese, or spreads.
sandwiches.Name: Smørrebrød

sandwiches.Description: Open-faced sandwich on rugbrød, with smoked herring, chives, and a raw egg yolk.
sandwiches.Name: Sol over Gudhjem

sandwiches.Description: Sizzling skewer of pork, or chicken roasted, shaved off the spit, and marinade ranging from hot barbecue to sweet, all laid out on a rolled pita bread, sprinkled with the choice of lettuce, tomato, cheese, red onion, and oregano, and doused with tzatziki sauce.
sandwiches.Name: Souvlaki

sandwiches.Description: Prepared with cooked spaghetti, sauce and bread.
sandwiches.Name: Spaghetti

sandwiches.Description: A hollowed out quarter loaf of bread, filled with a variety of ingredients such as chips, cheese, polony and atchar.
sandwiches.Name: Spatlo

sandwiches.Description: Marinated cubes of chicken, pork, lamb, veal, venison, or beef, grilled on a spit, and served in a bun.
sandwiches.Name: Spiedie

sandwiches.Description: Egg foo young patty (containing bean sprouts and minced white onions), dill pickle slices, white onion, mayonnaise, lettuce, and tomato on white bread.
sandwiches.Name: St. Paul

sandwiches.Description: Grilled, over-stuffed submarine roll, containing shaved steak, and topped with salami, melted provolone, sautéed onions, and bell peppers.
sandwiches.Name: Steak bomb

sandwiches.Description: Typically prepared with ground, sliced or minced beefsteak meat. Additional meats are also used.
sandwiches.Name: Steak burger

sandwiches.Description: Prepared with cooked steak, served on bread or a roll. Steak sandwiches may include toppings such as cheese, onions, mushrooms, bell peppers, hot peppers, tomatoes, and in some instances fried eggs, cole slaw, or french fries.
sandwiches.Name: Steak

sandwiches.Description: Generic sandwich served on a long French or Italian roll which may contain a wide variety of sliced meats, vegetables, and condiments, including lettuce, tomato, sweet peppers, onions, olives, and mushrooms. Also known regionally as a hero, a hoagie, a grinder, or a zep, among other names. In the United Kingdom it is named a baguette, after the French bread used to make it.
sandwiches.Name: Submarine/Sub/Baguette

sandwiches.Description: Common in Iowa, consists of a mixture of unseasoned ground beef and sauteed onions, sometimes topped with pickles, ketchup, and mustard, on a bun.
sandwiches.Name: Tavern

sandwiches.Description: Thinly sliced white bread with crusts removed, lightly buttered, containing a light spread of cream cheese or mayonnaise mixture, and often radishes, cucumber, asparagus, or watercress. Other fillings may be pimento cheese, ham with mustard, smoked salmon, fruit jam, curried chicken, and egg salad.
sandwiches.Name: Tea

sandwiches.Description: Thin slice of toast between two thin slices of bread with a layer of butter, and salt and pepper to taste.
sandwiches.Name: Toast

sandwiches.Description: Slice of toast with ham, a maraschino cherry in the middle of a pineapple slice, and cheese, grilled from above, so the cheese starts to melt.
sandwiches.Name: Toast Hawaii

sandwiches.Description: Two slices of bread with various fillings, toasted and edges sealed with a sandwich toaster.
sandwiches.Name: Toastie

sandwiches.Description: Tofu, typically broiled or baked, with vegetables.
sandwiches.Name: Tofu

sandwiches.Description: Sautéed beef tongue and scrambled eggs, served open-faced
sandwiches.Name: Tongue toast

sandwiches.Description: Mexican roll (either telera or bolillo) spread with mayo or refried beans and stuffed with various sliced meats, cheeses, vegetables (usually tomatoes, onions and avocado) and choice of pickled jalapeños or chipotle peppers. It can either be made ahead and tightly wrapped for a packed lunch or (if made to order) grilled on both sides with some butter.
sandwiches.Name: Torta

sandwiches.Description: Birote bread (similar to bolillo) filled with "carnitas" (deep-fried pork), shredded chicken or other meats, beans and cheese. The torta is then dipped in a very hot tomato and dried chile de árbol sauce and topped with pickled sliced onions.
sandwiches.Name: Torta ahogada

sandwiches.Description: Triangular white bread with the crusts removed, with fillings such as tuna and olive and prosciutto, served in Italian bars throughout the day.
sandwiches.Name: Tramezzino

sandwiches.Description: Slice of breaded meat, fried potatoes, a fried egg, rice, and salad (tomatoes, onions, and locotos) between two slices of bread.
sandwiches.Name: Trancapecho

sandwiches.Description: Usually made with tuna salad, which may include mayonnaise, sweetcorn, cucumber, or celery. Other common variations include the tuna boat and tuna melt.
sandwiches.Name: Tuna

sandwiches.Description: Hot open-faced sandwich on toasted bread with hot turkey, bacon, tomatoes, and a cheese sauce.
sandwiches.Name: Turkey Devonshire

sandwiches.Description: Usually made with smoked turkey, it can also have other ingredients and condiments, such as cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, mayonnaise, and mustard.
sandwiches.Name: Turkey

sandwiches.Description: Potato fritter coated in chickpea flour (batata vada) in a bun.
sandwiches.Name: Vada pav

sandwiches.Description: Vegemite is a dark brown Australian food paste made from used brewers' yeast extract, a by-product of beer manufacturing, various vegetables, wheat, and spice additives. It is a spread for sandwiches, toast, crumpets, and cracker biscuits, as well as a filling for pastries.
sandwiches.Name: Vegemite

sandwiches.Description: Hamburger-style patty made only of non-meat ingredients.
sandwiches.Name: Veggie burger

sandwiches.Description: Meats, cheeses, and vegetables served in a wrap.
sandwiches.Name: Wrap

sandwiches.Description: Simple and common German or Austrian sandwich prepared with thin slices of lunch meat or sausage, sometimes buttered. Variations include the addition of cheese or pickle slices.
sandwiches.Name: Wurstbrot (sausage bread)

sandwiches.Description: Hot dog bun stuffed with fried noodles, frequently topped with pickles, such as beni shōga, with mayonnaise.
sandwiches.Name: Yakisoba-pan

sandwiches.Description: Open-face sandwich on halved baguette or other long roll, usually topped with sautéed mushrooms, cheese, ham or other meats, and vegetables.  Toasted until cheese melts and served hot with ketchup.
sandwiches.Name: Zapiekanka
